desc:
Here's what it would look like in React:
`const MyComponent = claspImport('path/to/component')`
`<MyComponent />`

Clasp has no way of knowing what components 'path/to/component' will define, so it would be impossible to do something like:
`const { MyComponent } = ...`

This means we can only define one component per clasp URL.

Maybe something like this would work?
`const { MyComponent, SecondComponent } = claspImport('path/to/component', ['MyComponent', 'SecondComponent'])`

Clasp would then return something like:
`return { [prop[0]]: new Promise(...), [prop[1]]: ...`
name: Update API to specify the "default" export - the one that will be mapped to the Clasp component (e.g. in React)

desc:
The endpoint will take a single SHA so that the browser can easily cache it. The SHA will be the hash of the blob - not the source. If there is a match in the cache then it returns the blob for that SHA.

GET /<sha>
Returns blob where SHA(blob) = sha
name: Create API endpoint that queries by SHA

Upon successful testing CI will build images
CI will push images to the registry
